{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3569964,"name":"Esther Lee","username":"esty_besty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/esty_besty/{size}/239748_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T12:07:15.728Z","cooked":"

I’m researching more about differential gearboxes right now and I’ve found a feature script for making the bevel gears (Gear Lab) but it glitches out for me. Can anyone give me some other good bevel gear feature scripts or tell me what the issue might be? Here’s a photo of what happens

IMG_36273024×4032 5.98 MB

(This is when I tried mirroring a bevel gear and it turned weirdly hollow. I’ve had some other issues with the bore feature and stuff)

I’ve also had a hard time struggling with what module represents and how that relates to the gear. In the feature script whenever I put a certain module with a certain number of teeth, sometimes only a couple teeth appear and the rest of the gear turns smooth.

Also if anyone knows any robots from previous years with differentials that would be pretty helpful too

There is a whole world of differentials out there beyond just bevel gears.

As for robots 1690 had a great one in 2023,

5687 had some luck with their differential swerve on a comp bot in 2023. (Other teams tried as well, with various levels of success)
